item.description:
Have you resolved to do more for justice in 2010? Get started by connecting with like-minded progressives at SoJust's biggest event of the year!

With over 1200 members and 3+ years of creating a diverse cross-issue community in Boston, Socializing for Justice is the best place to find a way to make your resolution happen while putting the SOCIAL back in social justice.

As always we'll help you meet all the great people in the room - so no worries if you're new to SoJust, plus we'll have "looking for" and "ask me about" tags to make it even more likely you'll find the right connections.

Want to cross-promote your events and campaigns? Looking for like-minded progressives to hang out with in Boston? Are you new to the area and looking for groups to get involved in? Are you psyched about building strong cross-issue coalitions? Join us!

YES, WE MEAN YOU. We've got members of all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism and professions. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.

HEY ORGANIZERS! If you're involved with a group or project and want to spread the word bring flyers for the free lit table - and there'll be lots of opportunity to schmooze and network!

At Socializing for Justice (SoJust) events you can hang out with friends, make new ones, find a date, get the scoop on a job, and find out what's going on this weekend - political or social. And the best part is that SoJust members share your vision of building a more just world.

*The venue 18+ and is wheelchair accessible - elevator is at the back of the venue.
Lir is across from the Hynes Convention Center.

Wanna know more about SoJust? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions and past event photos!

Spread the word by inviting your friends to the facebook event: http://www.facebook.c...

Join the SoJust Facebook group: http://www.facebook.c...

Follow SoJust on Twitter: http://www.twitter.co...

UPDATE: Please bring cans for the Brookline Can Drive. Special thanks to SoJust member & Pita Pit owner Jessica Green for coordinating SoJust's participation. Everyone who donates gets a Pita Pit coupon, entered into a raffle and of course the great feeling of supporting over 200 local families.

Items to donate include non-perishable foods such as pasta, soups, canned tuna & meat, cereal & powdered milk, and toiletries.
